prompt: Is there a Windows application for live translation during calls in Google Meet or other meetings?

hidden_queries: Windows live translation during calls for Google Meet or other meetings Windows application live translation captions
Live translation app for Windows that provides real time translation in video calls Meet Zoom Teams subtitles
metadata.generated_search_query: Windows live translation during calls for Google Meet or other meetings Windows application live translation captions

sources.title: Use live captions to better understand audio - Microsoft Support
sources.snippet: When using a Copilot+ PC, live captions instantly translate any live or pre-recorded video in any app or video platform from over 40 languages into English and 27 languages into Chinese (Simplified). Live captions works across Windows 11, making it seamless to read captions while working in other apps.

citation_mappings.claim_text: Yes — there are Windows-compatible applications and built-in OS features that provide live translation or translated captions during meetings (Google Meet, Zoom, Teams, etc.). None are perfect plug-in magic but here are the reliable options: 1. Windows 11 Live Captions / Translation (built-in) Windows 11 includes Live Captions that can translate audio from any app in real time (including meetings) into captions in another language. Works system-wide. Microsoft Support

2. Third-party Windows apps that work with any meeting These install on your PC and act as a virtual audio device or overlay captions: Ztalk.ai – Windows app with real-time voice translation; you select it as your mic/speaker device and it translates live in >30 languages. Ztalk
LinguaX / Felo Subtitles – Live transcription + translated subtitles overlay for Zoom, Teams, Meet, etc. Felo Subtitles+1
PolyPal (Timekettle) – Live AI subtitles in ~43 languages. polypal.ai
Transync AI – Claims real-time translation for Zoom, Teams, Google Meet (Windows version). 同言翻译
3. Browser / Extension-based helpers Chrome extensions can add translated captions for Google Meet calls (not a standalone Windows app but works on Windows via browser). Tactiq

4. Platform-native / integrated features Not Windows apps per se, but relevant: Google Meet translated captions — Google Meet can show translated captions during calls if supported for your Workspace plan. Google Help
Zoom with Wordly extension — Zoom app + Wordly plugin gives live translated captions. Zoom Marketplace

sources.title: Microsoft Teams will help you speak in a foreign language during meetings
sources.snippet:
Microsoft Teams is introducing a new real-time AI-powered interpreter feature in early 2025, allowing meeting participants to speak and listen in their preferred language. This tool uses speech-to-speech translation and can simulate a user's personal voice in another language. Initially supporting up to nine languages, this feature is part of broader AI enhancements within Teams. Additionally, multilingual transcription for up to 31 languages will be supported for meeting transcripts.

Other enhancements include AI-powered summaries of visual content from PowerPoint or the web shown during meetings, and the ability of Microsoft Copilot to summarize files shared in the Teams chat. Microsoft will also roll out a Teams Super Resolution feature for Copilot Plus PCs using local NPU chips to improve video call quality under weak internet conditions. Developers will gain access to image super resolution APIs, and updates to the Copilot Runtime will introduce functions such as image segmentation, object erase, and image description.

citation_mappings.claim_text: Microsoft Teams built-in translation / AI interpreter — Teams is rolling out real-time speech translation features and live captions; some are built into Teams itself. The Verge

sources.title: Live Translation Options for Google Meet in 2025: New Feature and More
sources.snippet: New Live Translation, multi-language captions, or translated captions - learn how you can remove communication barriers from your Google Meet meetings.

citation_mappings.claim_text: What to expect Live text captions + translation are common and dependable. Live voice-to-voice translation exists but requires dedicated apps (e.g., Ztalk.ai). Accuracy varies with language pair, background noise, and speech clarity. Integration inside Google Meet natively is limited — Google’s own AI-powered speech translation is rolling out slowly and may only cover some languages unless you use extensions or third-party tools. interprefy.com
